      • Screen

        public Screen(int columnIndex,
              int rowIndex,
              int width,
              int height)
        Constructs a new AsciiScreen.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The x-axis (column) coordinate of the top-left character.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate of the top-left character.
        width - The width, in characters.
        height - The height, in characters.

      • draw

        public void draw(Graphics2D gc,
                 ColoredImageCache imageCache)
        Draws the screen onto the specified canvas using the specified font.
        Parameters:
        gc - The graphics context to draw with.
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve character images from.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the gc or image cache is null.

      • clear

        public void clear(char character)
        Clears the entire screen.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to replace every character on the screen with.

      • clear

        public void clear(char character,
                  int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Clears the specified section of the screen. Does nothing if the (columnIndex, rowIndex) or (width, height) pairs point to invalid positions.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to replace all characters being cleared with.
        columnIndex - The x-axis (column) coordinate of the cell to clear.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate of the cell to clear.
        width - The width of the area to clear.
        height - The height of the area to clear.

      • write

        public void write(AsciiCharacter character,
                  int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex)
        Write the specified character to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        character - The character.
        columnIndex - The x-axis (column) coordinate to write to.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate to write to.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the character is null.

      • write

        public void write(AsciiString string,
                  int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex)
        Write a string to the specified position. Does nothing if the (columnIndex, rowIndex) points to invalid position.
        Parameters:
        string - The string.
        columnIndex - The x-axis (column) coordinate to begin writing from.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate to begin writing from.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the string is null.

      • write

        public void write(String string,
                  int columnIndex,
                  int rowIndex)
        Write a string to the specified position. Does nothing if the (columnIndex, rowIndex) points to invalid position.
        Parameters:
        string - The string.
        columnIndex - The x-axis (column) coordinate to begin writing from.
        rowIndex - The y-axis (row) coordinate to begin writing from.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the string is null.

      • screenshot

        public BufferedImage screenshot(ColoredImageCache imageCache)
        Draws the screen onto an image. This calls the draw function, so the screen may look a little different if there are blink effects or new updates to characters that haven't yet been drawn. This is an expensive operation as it essentially creates an in-memory screen and draws each AsciiCharacter onto that screen.
        Parameters:
        imageCache - The image cache to retrieve character images from.
        Returns:
        An image of the screen.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the image cache is null.
